Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: witnessed by Gazetteer SF after the rally at Jessie and Sixth streets in SoMa

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Many unhoused people, including Robinson, say it can be challenging to identify and retrieve their belongings at the facility.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: shared experience with the challenge of retrieving belongings at the storage facility

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Between December 2022 and June of this year, a federal injunction prevented the city from penalizing people for sleeping on public property without an alternative offer for shelter.
Document Sources.Source Justification: relevant to the city's policy change on penalizing people for sleeping on public property

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.
Document Sources.Source Justification: provides data on the number of unhoused people and shelter beds in the city

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.
Document Sources.Source Justification: outlines the protocol for encampment sweeps

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: as a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Document Sources.Source Justification: provides evidence of breaches in protocol by Public Works

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: There were 178 people on the Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing’s online waitlist for shelter on Monday afternoon.
Document Sources.Name of Source: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing’s online waitlist
Document Sources.Source Justification: provides data on the demand for shelter in the city

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: All they do is tell me to go back to the Hunters Point Navigation Center. And I don’t want to do that. I had bad experiences,” he said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: resident of the encampment, sharing personal experience

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: I don’t understand,” O’Brien kept repeating.
he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: resident of the encampment, interacting with law enforcement

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.

I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier. It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Communications and Policy Director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: expertise on the city's sweep protocols and advocate for the unhoused

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: official response to questions about potential breaches in protocol

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: official stance on the purpose of the sweeps

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: In order to bring public attention to the moral question of sweeps, the Coalition on Homelessness and other unhoused advocates planned to crash an encampment sweep in SoMa last Thursday, which had been scheduled for 12:30 p.m.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: organizer of a protest against the sweeps

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: as a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: provider of public records highlighting breaches in protocol

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: There were 178 people on the Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing’s online waitlist for shelter on Monday afternoon.
Named Organization Sources.Name of Source: Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: maintainer of the online waitlist for shelter
